p: Mesosphaerum suaveolens (syn. Hyptis suaveolens) is used in popular medicine to treat fungal infections by applying a paste made from the crushed leaves on the affected area ( Wiart et al., 2004; Policepatel and Manikrao, 2013). Thus, aqueous extracts from the leaves and aerial parts of this plant were assessed in association with fluconazole, an antifungal drug commercially available. The results showed that the extract from the leaves modulated the fluconazole activity against Candida albicans. Furthermore, the extract from the aerial parts also demonstrated potentiating effects of the drug, both to Candida albicans and Candida parapsilosis strains ( Costa et al., 2020).
